title: Vogue India - May 2016 (gnv64)
description:
Vogue India - May 2016
English | 260 pages | True PDF | 95.7 mb

Before it's in fashion, it's in Vogue. Everything you need to know about fashion, trends, beauty, people and lifestyle, VOGUE India is your ultimate style guide. In these pages youâ€™ll find the hottest, newest and latest from the world of fashion and beyond, both in India and from across the world, making it the must-have accessory for the modern, fashionable Indian woman.

156 THE REAL DEAL
Anushka Sharma is the queen of transformation. With a spectrum of new movies in the can this year, including one in which she plays a wrestler, she is ready to show her true grit, says Megha Mahindru. Photographed by Errikos Andreou. Styled by Anaita Shro Adajania
188 MOODY BLUES
Stormy indigo. Delicate periwinkle. Regal sapphire. Refreshing turquoise. Thereâ€™s no other colour in the
spectrum that spans so many moods. For the heady days of summer, blue is the coolest colour. Photographed by Luis Monteiro. Styled by Anaita Shro Adajania
166 STOP  STARE
For many seasons now, the focus at fashion week has been on the â€˜show outside the showâ€™, with the streetstyle phenomenon setting o a social media frenzy like no other. What editors, models, It girls (and
real girls!) wear creates instant buzz, and though it may all seem e ortless, thereâ€™s a method to the madness. Mix and clash highstreet hits with luxe separates, and watch those fl ashbulbs pop. Photographed by Kiki Xue. Styled by Fabio Immediato
184 A SELFIE WITH STEVE
It is a rare gift to retain the receptiveness of a curious traveller after 40 years of knowing. Is this what lies behind Magnum photographer Steve McCurryâ€™s popular appeal and could his travellerâ€™s eye help us
see ourselves better, asks Anindita Ghose. Photographed by Adil Hasan
174 LEADERS OF THE PACK
Itâ€™s the season of the bold, brilliant and built-to-move super satchel. Gigi Hadid and Lily Aldridge take the brightest of the bunch on an energetic romp for spring. Photographed by Patrick Demarchelier. Styled by Tabitha Simmons.
